hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via Failed High-Low Break
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL regime, when BTC attempts a breakout above the 20-day high but closes in bottom 30% of daily range with declining volume, followed by a break below the 5-day low next session, regime transitions to BEAR with 70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Failed breakouts on low volume indicate lack of conviction. Subsequent breakdown through near-term support confirms distribution. Current regulatory news flow (MiCA) creates asymmetric sensitivity to failed upside attempts.
entry_conditions: Day 1: BTC trades above 20-day high but closes in bottom 30% of daily range
Day 2: BTC breaks below 5-day low before 12:00 UTC
Cumulative volume delta turns negative over 2-hour period post-break

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime shifts to BEAR OR 4% decline from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reclaims 5-day low and holds for 4 hours

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such patterns see immediate reversal (bear trap) and continuation of neutral/consolidation phase.
